search_information.business: The Vortex Bar And Grill - Midtown

comment.text:
I'm still thinking about these wings!
We had never been to this place until today. The vibe was great, the service was great, the food was great, we even got to see a birthday drink off (which was really cool and made me want to come back for my birthday) All around, It was truly a great outing! Just remember you have to be 21+ to come in at all times!

The funnel stick fries were delicious (not pictured) but were a great recommendation from our waitress for pairs to share!

My only "con" to this specific location is the parking situation. The lot directly across cost $15 to park and with both of us driving we spent $30 parking and $40 on food... it was definitely an expensive outing so my recommendation would be to carpool or park free on a nearby street and walk over.

Peanut butter on  hamburger! Who knew this would work
I had to try it  must admit first bit was interesting, but then you taste the crisp bacon and the sweetness of the fried plantain! Don't know how it happened, but next thing I know the burger was gone! The entire burger! Yes, I'll be back for another thank you!
Also tried, black and white! Guiness with amber ale! Again, couldn't decided if I liked it, till the 2 glass! This may be my drink of the summer! 
2nd time coming to Vortex, I can see this being my go to spot for Guiness and burger!

We went on a Saturday night so of course the wait was ridiculous but we had so much fun at the bar and taking pics that it went by fast. Food, as always, was incredible. We got a mix of burgers and I tried the turkey chili for the first time. So good!!! Overall, great experience. Got some attitude from a server, but everything else made up for it.

My husband and I were craving some solid meaty burgers so we ordered take-out from Vortex. The order was ready fairly quickly and it was a positive pickup experience.

Let's start with the burgers. We got one Classic Bypass (topped with a fried egg, American cheese, and bacon) and one Retro Diner Burger (2 sirloin patties, Swiss and Cheddar cheese, grilled onion, dill pickle). Everything was fresh and of good quality. The Retro Diner Burger was exactly what we expected. However, my Classic Bypass was very bland and slightly dry, lacking the smokey grill flavor as well. Overall it's quite different from when we visited in person pre-COVID.

On the positive side, we loved the Dixie Wrecked Taters, tator tots covered in sausage gravy, cheddar cheese, and bacon!! The potato salad, also has bacon and cheese, is to die for!
I'd go back just for these.

We will give it another try when we go back to normal for sure!

Food is A1! Got the barbecue bacon mac and cheese burger with a side of dixie wrecked tots and it did not disappoint! Both foods were solid choices and literally hit home. The flavors in the burger were nice and saucy and the tots just felt like home with the gravy. 10/10 would recommend.

I am a native Atlantan, but had never dined at The Vortex. I am now disappointed in myself that it took so long!!! The burgers were EVERYTHING!!! Very flavorful!!
I had the house salad topped with sirloin burger! It was amazing!!! 
We loved the service and people-watching on the patio!!
WARNING, you must be 21 with ID check at the door. 
There is a huge phallus near the entrance!! It's supposed to bring good luck when rubbed!! :-)

photos.caption: House Salad topped with sirloin burger!!!

comment.text: This place has a Kuma's Corner feel. We were told to come for the burgers- they were okay. Drinks were basic- the server kept referring to the place as "a dive." But the fried pickles were excellent. I did find it odd that my group (3 minorities) were sat upstairs along with 3 other groups of minorities. When I used the washroom there was 1 black couple in the main seating area- coincidental, perhaps?

I love this place mainly for their drinks. It's always a fun spot to start your night. The food is good and the place is decorated in an eclectic way. You can also sit on the patio with a view of the street.  It's always a good time here!

Any burger

I've stayed nearby quite a few times now but have purposefully passed as I've been to one of the other locations some years back and like to check out new spots. That said, I was looking for a post-workout protein fix before I crashed for the night and figured this would be as good of a place as any. This location has the same divey atmosphere I remember and I liked that they were checking people at the door. The menu has a huge selection of fancy burgers and I went with the guac version done medium rare. It was served to perfection with a good helping of fries. Service was attentive and I was even offered a to go cup for my Diet Coke. This would be a great place to stop back for dinner and drinks. I'd definitely do Vortex again over other chains on the block like Taco Mac.

It was super good. The taters were kinda of heavy and a little salty but the burger was really juicy and flavorful. They really have the best burgers and you can't go wrong with their fried pickles. They came out so fresh and the ranch is just spectacular. They put some love into that ranch. They also just have really good pickles in general. The seating was very spread out. Everybody had masks on. The vibe was cool

photos.caption: Swiss & Mushroom w bacon and  Dixie Wrecked Taters

comment.text: just really rude people. Felt unwelcome the minute I walked in till the moment I left.

a must visit bar in atlanta! The food and drinks are both so good. The bacon Mac n cheese burger is SO GOOD and the perfect size sharing with an appetizer for lunch. We also got the chicken wrap appetizer it was great. The decor and the whole restaurant is so cool too

I came with my friends the first time Friday. as a service industry worker, the menu said everything  that's ever needed to be said to the general public. they had an awesome selection of drinks. and the burger I got was the best I'd had in a LONG time. so glad we decided to go, definitely a well known spot in atl for a reason.

A must! Great service, AWESOME food, best burgers & nachos for sure. Great place. Highly recommend it. Returned two days back to back! A must for burger lovers, great local draft beers. Cheers, enjoy! Thank me later...

My hubby and I  have been wanting to try the burgers at the Vortex for awhile. We stopped in the other day while in the area. I usually am not a huge burger aficionado like my better half but I wanted to try one. I picked the 
KA'MANA WA'NA LEI'YA 
A scoop of chipotle cream cheese, 3 slices of bacon and spicy pineapple jalapeño jelly on Texas toast. This burger  was slap your mama good!!! OMGosh Heaven 
The Vortex has ruined me for any other burger. Nothing better than this burger. Seriously.

photos.caption: Vortex burger Ka'Mana wa'na lei'ya   Chipotle cream cheese, pineapple jalapeño jam omg

comment.text:
Overrated. Don't go to the skull lounge l, the ushers are rude. 

The food was okay. The waitress and hostess were amazing. It was loud and we couldn't hear each other talk.
This restaurant was not what I expected. Atmosphere was not conducive for dinner. More of a bar atmosphere. Food was not very good. Cheap food for a premium price. Service was great.

Walk in and just check out the décor. Very cool stuff. Great, unique atmosphere. I have always wanted to try other sandwiches but I always go with a burger. It is just so good its hard to pass up. Service was good, our server was very attentive and orders were accurate.
Food was fairly average.  Food is underseasoned and even though some of the overall appeal is their unhealthy but loaded burgers, they felt like they were lacking flavor.

Horrible service. Food was alright. We didn't get our drinks until 10 minutes after our food came. Waitress was so rude for no reason. African American, long hair, short and looks like she put her service under the name "Ryan." This was Monday October 17th for lunch. Took home burger, but didn't finish it and threw it out. Drink tasted like bubble gum and I didn't finish it- just poured it in my water cup LOL since I paid for the glass.

Legit, a good time. The atmosphere is great!  Don't let it fool you, the burgers are great...
The burger with guac was tasty, however the burger with...bbq sauce, Mac and cheese....def was the best !

My first and last time coming here. I moved to Atlanta 6 yrs ago and I've always heard abt the delicious burgers here so we decided to give it a try.  Mannnnn, after being in the restaurant for 90 mins somebody burst my window and went under my seat to steal my job's laptop that was prob worth $400-$500 that I need to use all the time. I'm a Firefighter/Paramedic serving and helping the community and barely making it to survive day to day and some sorry A$$ cost me more money than the laptop is worth. It cost $600 to replace my side windows.  The cop shows up in a timely manner and tells us ppl break in hundreds of cars ALL THE TIME in the parking lot and the cameras do NOT work... So I come out to enjoy a burger and end up spending over $600. I wonder why is t there a security guard posted up. These businesses make lots of $$$ and why aren't the cameras working. I'm 2022 operable Cameras are pretty cheap to installed and operate from an app but I guess the criminal minded person will continued to have a "feast" breaking in cars if no changes are being made. The burgers were great not worth the agony of worrying abt my car being harm.
Gee thanks. I should have gone to Burger King for a burger. . I won't be back..... EVER...

I had the Hell's Fury burger which was an experience in itself! It has jalapeño jack cheese, pepper relish, and death sauce! It made my face turn red but I ate the whole thing! I haven't been to the vortex in quite some time so to have a good experience was great! The only thing I disliked were the shoe string fries...I prefer a thicker cut but you go to vortex for the burgers... not the fries.

Come ready to wolf down some hearty food! If you're here for dinner though, expect a short wait. Remember that it's 21+ no exceptions, and that the security guard will ID you at the front or at the table if no one is at the front.

I don't often crave burgers, but if I do, Vortex really hits the spot. I got the 'KA'MANA WA'NA LEI'YA' which is a tropical burger that has a big glob of chipotle cream cheese, bacon, and pineapple jalapeño jelly. I could have gone with less chipotle cream cheese, but I guess it's for the aesthetic. Pineapple jalapeño jelly really slapped though! I found myself dipping my fries in the excess. 

Also, this is one of the few places in Midtown that serves pickle fries and I'm always a sucker for those!

They have an extensive beer selection, and fun raunchy decor ranging from tame dusty license plates to playboy covers and a large dick statue at the front. It's almost always loud and dark inside and much hubbub going around. Have fun yall!

This is by far my favorite Vortex location! Your ID is checked at the door and you won't be allowed in if you're not at-least 21 years old. The inside decor is very entertaining and is not for the easily offended lol. 

The menu is quite extensive and filled with unique burgers and drinks. Want to land yourself a hospital visit?Try the Triple Coronary Bypass burger estimated at over 7,000 calories! My friend and I weren't feeling that adventurous and opted for the holy guacamole burger and the black and blue. Both delicious, made fresh, and arguably the best burgers we've ever had! For our drinks we had mystery shots (bartenders choice) and beer. 

This location also has a comedy bar in the back. I haven't been able to check it out yet but that's next on my bucket list!

I hate to say that I lived in Atlanta for 4 years and not once did I go to The Vortex. I'm aware of this location and another in Little Five Points. My frat brother invited me to grab lunch there and I love burgers so of course I was down. We parked on the street. It was a calm Saturday afternoon. 

They ID at the front. That may be why I never went while I lived downtown in college. The location gave me bar/restaurant vibes. I ordered the Holy Guacamole with tater tots. It was fantastic. I believe that all of the burgers come with a side for the most part. I also ordered a 12 ounce IPA for like $5. The drinks were pretty cheap as well as the food. I paid for our lunch and spent $40. 

I definitely witnessed what the hype was about The Vortex. I will for sure be going back.

Hadn't been in probably 20 years but the burger was as good as I remember it back then! Great spot to catch up with a colleague after work. Kitschy atmosphere and good burgers and brew! Only downside was it took about 15 minutes before a server came by the table but once we got connected, all was well!

The Vortex is one of my favorite places to take someone on a special occasion. I took my best friend here for his birthday earlier this year, and he took me this past week.

They have a wide variety of specialty burgers, and my personal favorite is the single corinary  bypass. It's a sirloin burger, a fried egg, and the bun is 2 bacon grilled cheese sandwiches... and this is on top of tater tots and French fries covered in cheesey cheese goo and tater tots. I'm not ever able to finish the sandwich, but it's just as good when I finish at home.

Food, service, and ambiance are all amazing. I especially loved the decor BUT I hated the menu and all the damn rules. For a place that is supposed to be the vortex to the nether world there sure are a lot of rules about how to dine there. Who likes rules at a burger joint? However, the burgers and the tater tots made up for the rules (front and back of the menu). The burger was an amazing medium rare and cooked perfectly. Additionally, those tater tots were the best I've ever had. DANK. The waiter was really great and I REALLY appreciated his recommendations.

If you're looking for the best burger in town, look no further. The Vortex is the place to get your burger craving fixed. 

They have an extensive menu with lots of burgers. I enjoyed mine as it had bacon and BBQ sauce. I wouldn't choose any other place to get a burger. You will not be disappointed.
This place is great. All the food taste amazing. Recommend the zombie apocalypse. Customer service is great

A lot of blogs say this place has the best burgers in town and I was craving a burger so I ordered the bacon cheeseburger online with fried zucchini.

This place is located in Midtown and (at least right now) there is some street parking and a small parking lot across the street that you have to pay for, if you drive too fast you will pass it (like I did). 

This place has a whole bar atmosphere with low lighting, looks like a fun place to be after covid, the staff was friendly and I got my order right away. 

As far as the food goes, I ordered my burger medium well and got it well done, the burger was much bigger than I thought it would be (in a good way) and was very tasty, is it the best burger in Atlanta? Eh I've had some just as good but it is a great burger. 

The fried zucchini and the sauce it came with definitely was much better than I thought it would be! Even though I had a good amount I wanted more.

Next time I want to try one of their other specialty burgers.

This is one of those places that I feel like most people will recommend to eat at when you say you are visiting Atlanta. It's a unique place as far as decor/theme and the food is amazing. My friend and I decided to get two burgers and split them. We were having a hard time choosing which two burgers to get so we gave our server a few options and asked him which two we should get. He responded with no hesitation about the two we should order so we felt confident in the choices that were made. Both burgers were equally delicious, I'm not sure I could pick a favorite. This is definitely a place I would go again next time I am in town!

The atmosphere is alternative and welcomes all types of people! The service is outstanding, and has one of the best burgers in all of Atlanta!! The house salad is fresh and pretty large!! If this is your first time, you will be taken aback by the atmosphere and not expect great food, and then you will be amazed at the food and you will catch the vibe and this will become your favorite place to get a burger.  Do not talk yourself out of the chicken wings!! I fell in love with this place!
The atmosphere and drinks are awesome! Staff was super friendly and prompt. Would definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in town and looking for something a little less "uppity".
AMAZING Burgers. I have yet to come across a burger place that tops this in the city.

My boyfriend and I came here after I picked up him up from the airport. I got the Hell's Fury burger with the Atomic Death sauce on the side. Our waitress suggested for the sauce to be on the side because it was extremely spicy. We started off our dinner with the dixie wrecked "taters" and were given the choice between fries or tater tots. We chose the fries. It was delicious. My boyfriend got the mac and cheese burger and he said it was delicious. The Hell's Fury was very spicy. I enjoy spicy food but that too spicy for me. I had to scrape off the jalapeno and the habanero relish. I tried a bit of the atomic death sauce along with a piece of my burger and my mouth was on fire! I chose tater tots as my side to go along with my burger. I would definitely come back here again!

TLDR; some of the best burgers I've ever had and they're huge! If you go at the right time, you can try their bypass burgers, which look insane. 

I didn't think much of this burger chain...it just looks like a dive bar serving pretty average food. But that definitely was not the case. 

Classic bypass burger: essentially a bacon cheeseburger but there's onions and pickles as well. The whole thing is huge, and I really had to squish the burger down just to take a bite. Gets messy so have plenty of napkins ready! Comes with a side and I got tater tots. Nothing really special about them. 

Off the deep end: apparently this is one of their strongest drinks. It comes with several different kinds of vodkas but you can't really taste it. Kind of dangerous! 

Highly recommend! But maybe share the dish with another person. Half of the burger definitely would've been enough for me.

We met some friends here for lunch on a Friday about noon. The place was not very busy but quickly filled up. I was the last one to arrive to meet my wife and our friends.

They already ordered and received their food and my wife ordered something for me when I told her I was on my way. When I arrived I went in and found them and the server came by. I placed an order for a beverage and she brought out my food. I saw that my wife had the peanut butter bacon burger which she loves. She said it was delicious. For me she ordered the Mac N Cheesy Changa appetizer. She knew it was right up my alley when she read it on the menu. It is BBQ pulled pork and macaroni and cheese wrapped up in a flour tortilla, deep fried, sliced and drizzled with more cheese. It looked delicious and tasted just as good.

We sat and chatted a while until we each had to be on our way. Overall it was a good experience. I would highly recommend trying either the peanut butter bacon burger or Mac N Cheesy Changa.

photos.caption: Mac N Cheesy Changa - BBQ pulled pork and mac & cheese wrapped in a flour tortilla then deep fried, sliced and drizzled with cheese
Mac N Cheesy Changa - BBQ pulled pork and mac & cheese wrapped in a flour tortilla then deep fried, sliced and drizzled with cheese
Mac N Cheesy Changa - BBQ pulled pork and mac & cheese wrapped in a flour tortilla then deep fried, sliced and drizzled with cheese

comment.text:
The food here is really good. The burger I had was the blue schroom and it was an amazing burger but the hype is insane about this place. Yes, it's good but it's not worth the craziness. 
We had no wait on Sunday evening even though the hostess said the wait was 30 mins .. she ended up finding a few tables 2 minutes later. I've walked by before and the wait was over an hour and I would not wait that long to eat here having now eaten here. 

However, the decor is interesting such as the nudity and genitalia throughout. 

The drinks are cheap. The food is average priced for a bar burger ~$12 but cheap if you consider you get bacon and other toppings. 

It was really stuffy inside, people packed everywhere so definitely bar mentality. Too claustrophobic tbh. They allow smoking so don't breathe too deeply. 

Parking available in lots nearby.
Funky and tasty  decor is something else.. I LOVE IT! Fav burger is definitely the fat Elvis . Peanut butter on a burger is the BEST combination !!!!!!!

It's been awhile since I've been to the Vortex and went yesterday with some friends. We had the best time. The drinks, food, environment, and the service was amazing.

Ryan was our server and she was amazing.  She was professional, fun, and attentive. We will always seek her when we return.

I've ordered the No bean chili for anthrird time. It's never hot almost cold. I sent it back twice but they made me feel so bad. How would you like to me make it better? Make some tempature hot chili.

photos.caption: Spicy Beef Chili... it's never tempature hot

comment.text: Terrible service. Terrible drinks. Terrible management. The food was plain and mediocre as well, literally bad diner quality level, not restaurant. I will never back.

We were in town for a concert and found this place on yelp. We stopped in prior to the show for a burger and beers. The food was amazing. I had the blue shroom burger and tater tots. My husband had the alpine burger with onion rings. Both were great! We loved it here so much that we went back for a second time on our 2 day trip.

I was told by a colleague of mine to try this place while in Atlanta, particularly the Peanut Butter and Banana Burger... Yea, that's never going to happen, however I did order the Apocalypse Burger, Boyfriend ordered the Bacon Mac and Cheese Burger. Both were absolutely phenomenal. Ordered wings as well, which were really spicy. I will absolutely come back for the burgers, probably not the wings though. 

Overall this place is super cool. I like the décor and the vibe a lot. It's very lively and entertaining. That being said, it can get a bit crowded, so if you're okay with a 20 minute wait, then you should give it a shot. Hip and Trendy place to be on a Friday Night!!!

This is a fun place to eat. In the middle of midtown where all the action is going on, you will see security at the entrance. They offer outdoor or indoor seating which includes a smoking section and non smoking. I found this odd that a restaurant still has a "smoking" section.

Anyway when your first walk in, it's hard to miss the big penis statue on your way to your table. Needless to say this restaurant is not for children lol I would say their claim to fame is their burgers. We came here with a larger party and had to wait a little bit. Since people in our party were asthmatic we had to wait for non-smoking. 

The burgers range from a boring plain burger to the Elvis burger. Of course I ordered the Elvis burger which includes peanut butter, plantains, and bacon with a beef patty. I did not get bacon with it, but of course I got everything else. I sat with people who all ordered boring plain burgers but they all said this was the best burger they have tasted (by the way it's not fun unless other ppl get an interesting burger with you IMO lol). 

You can also swap out the patty's to satisfy your dietary needs. They even have an impossible vegan burger for those non meat eaters! You can swap out any patty for their different signature burgers or build your own. I liked the array of sides offered, but the premium ones have uncharges. This is definitely a great cheat spot for adults only fun. 

By the way, they have a comedy club in the back!

photos.caption: Elvis burger (w/o bacon) with a fork mark because I wanted to taste the peanut butter! Lol

comment.text: Went here Friday. Wait time was extremely long even though we was on a list. Kept asking the host how long he kept giving attitude. We waited about 1 hour and 1/2- 1 hour and 45 mins before we was even seated. When we finally was seated we was greeted by our waiter. She was very nice and helpful. I ordered the hot wings and the nachos. The Buffalo wings sauce was very good. Best Buffalo wing sauce I've ever tasted. The blue cheese was very delicious taste like it was homemade. The sweet tea was okay it came in a 32oz cup lol. The nachos was tasty. I added chicken on it, chicken wasn't all that great. I probably coke back just for the wings and blue cheese

Decent burger. I got the Holy Guacamole burger which had guac, cheese, pickles, onion, lettuce and tomato. You can choose the temperature of your meat. I got medium well. It was good. Wasn't the best burger I had but pretty good. I also ordered the fried pickles and yummmm! They were so good! I would pass on the tator tots next time. They were too crunchy. Fries were really good as well. Overall a fun place to grab a bite. We were seated right away on a Sunday night and service was fast 


Parking is street parking for 6 dollars for 2 hours. Found a spot pretty easily.

Fabulous burgers, a great selection of beers and reasonable pricing on drinks. Enjoyed the decorations and atmosphere, definitely worth going out of your way for. Zombie apocalypse burger is fantastic, get the funnel cake fries! Fried plantains is also awesome.

photos.caption: Zombie Apocalypse and Funnel Cake Fries
Cheese-Balls O Glory- they are glorious
